intro: Alchemilla alpina subvar. petiolulans, commonly known as the Alpine Lady’s Mantle, is a perennial plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It features basal leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in a dense layer of soft, silvery-white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plant collections.
